summary: The government contracts with private companies, known as plan sponsors, to provide Medicare Part D prescription drug coverage. Pharmacy benefit managers work with plan sponsors to negotiate drug price rebates for Medicare, among other things. In 2016, these rebates offset Part D spending by 20%, from $145 billion to $116 billion. We also found that Pharmacy benefit managers' compensation for working with plan sponsors primarily...
title: Medicare Part D: Use of Pharmacy Benefit Managers and Efforts to Manage Drug Expenditures and Utilization
